name: imageDrawRoundRect
syntax: imageDrawRoundRect(name, x, y, width, height, arcwidth, archeight [, filled])
member: someImage.drawRoundRect(x, y, width, height, arcwidth, archeight [, filled])
description: Draws a rectangle with rounded corners.

params.name: name
params.description: The image on which this operation is performed.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the rectangle.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the rectangle.

params.name: arcwidth
params.description: The horizontal diameter of the arc at the four corners.

params.name: archeight
params.description: The vertical diameter of the arc at the four corners.

params.name: filled
params.description: Specify whether the rectangle is filled

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: This example shows how to draw a square with rounded corners.
examples.code:
<!--- Create a 200x200-pixel image. ---> 
 <cfset myImage=imageNew("",200,200)> 
 <!--- Set the drawing color for the image to blue. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetDrawingColor(myImage,"blue")> 
 <!--- Turn on antialiasing to improve image quality. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetAntialiasing(myImage,"on")> 
 <!--- Draw a blue filled square with round corners of arcWidth=10 and arcHeight=2. ---> 
 <cfset imageDrawRoundRect(myImage,5,5,190,190,"yes",10,2)> 
 <!--- Display the image in a browser. ---> 
 <cfimage source="#myImage#" action="writeToBrowser">

examples.title: Using drawRoundRect member function
examples.description: CF11+ Lucee4.5+ Create a new image. With the new image draw filled rounded rectangle (width=70, height=50) starting at point (x=40,y=50)
